Description: Small cone carved from rock crystal, possibly a game-piece or a stamp of some kind; the top of the cone is flat; polished.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Maroni, Site A surface find
Curator's comments: The function of this item is unclear, though the lack of perforation suggests it was not a bead or pendant. It may have been used for making simple stamp marks, though again one would expect some sort of suspension hole if it were a tool. Some sort of counter or gaming piece is therefore possible. See SCE IV/1D, 545-6 and 606 for examples of stone items, including rock crystal.
